Introduction to Networking.question: This is the basic building block of information, and it becomes meaningful when processed or interpreted.
What is the primary characteristic of data?
Which of the following statements is true about information?
Introduction to Networking.answer: Information is derived from processing and organizing data
incorrect: Information is always in a raw and unprocessed state

Introduction to Networking.question: The exchange of information in binary form between two connected devices, whether directly or through a network?
It is one of the communication tasks which refers to the need to convert the input data (digital) into a suitable form (analog) for transmission and vice-versa during reception.
It allows the system to resume an activity previously interrupted by an unexpected fault in the system. What communication task is that?

It is the agreement between devices on various conventions, such as transmission method (simplex, half or full duplex), data block length, data format, error detection and correction, and how fast data must be sent. What communication task is that?
It is one of the communication tasks wherein it allows the receiver to determine when a signal begins, and when it ends, and how long each signal element is.

It is one of the communication tasks wherein it is required for configuring and monitoring the system, allowing it to react rationally to failures and overloads, and to effectively plan for future expansion.
It ensures that in multi-user environment, the information is sent to the correct destination, and that the best possible route to this destination is chosen. What communication task is that?
It is the need to efficiently use various transmission facilities that are commonly shared by other devices? What communication task is that?

Networking Basics.question: All of these are advantages of Networking except?
Networking Basics.answer: Puts your system at risk from hackers and computer virus infection

Networking Basics.question: What term best describes the practice of connecting multiple computers and other devices together to share resources, exchange data, and communicate with each other?
It is usually a high-end computer that provides services to other computers on the network.
It is usually a high-end computer that provides services to other computers on the network.
It is a computer that is both a server and a client.
The language that the computers on the network use. It defines the rules of communication for the computers.
A computer that avails of the services provided by the server, usually less powerful than the server.
A computer that avails of the services provided by the server, usually less powerful than the server.
The server in this model does everything-processing, retrieval and storage of data.
It is very similar to distributed computing; in fact, it has basically the same strengths and weaknesses.
Which of the following is the advantage of distributed computing?
Networking Basics.answer: Users may run different applications at the same time
incorrect: Difficulty in file synchronization and back up
Provides slow data access and processing

Networking Basics.question: Computers in this network type are capable of being both a server and a client.
All of the following are advantages of Peer-to-Peer Networking except:
Networking Basics.answer: Scattered data, each machine must be back up individually
incorrect: No additional requirements for operating systems

Networking Basics.question: Which of the following is the disadvantage of Server-based Networking?
Networking Basics.answer: Requires specialized software, further adding to the cost
incorrect: Much more secure with user-level security and Access Control Lists
Eliminates the need for powerful and expensive

Networking Basics.question: Which of the following is not a condition to choose a server-based network type?
Networking Basics.answer: The network components are concentrated within a small area
incorrect: The network requires centralized control, good security, simplified resource management, or easy backup
Specialized servers must be installed to increase network efficiency

Networking Basics.question: All of the following are conditions to use peer-to-peer networking type except?
Networking Basics.answer: The organization is not on a strict budget.
incorrect: There are no more than 10 clients, with 5 being the ideal number.
All network components can fit in one small area.
There is no requirement for specialized servers.

Networking Basics.question: It is the smallest of the networks because the computers are confined in a small area, typically in a within a building.
Connecting these LANs create this type of network, which is actually a network of interconnected LANs. Due the distance involved, these are the slowest network type, and more prone to errors.
These are slower than LANs, and special equipment are required to connect the LANs. In most cases, these are operated by a local government or a communications carrier.
A network connecting computers within a single office building, allowing employees to share files, printers, and access shared resources.
A multinational corporation with offices in different continents needs to share confidential business data securely. What network type is most suitable?
A small cafe wants to provide free Wi-Fi to its customers across several adjacent buildings. What type of network does the cafe need to set up?
A factory needs to connect machinery and sensors within the facility for real-time monitoring and control. What network type would be suitable?
An oil drilling company has multiple rigs in the ocean and needs to maintain communication between them. What network type can facilitate this?
A city's public transportation system wants to implement a network for tracking buses and providing real-time updates to passengers. What network type would they rely on?

The Theoretical Framework.question: This is the top layer of the OSI model which provides a set of interfaces for sending and receiving applications to gain access to and use network services.
Manages data-format information for networked communications (the network’s translator).
This layer enables two networked resources to hold ongoing communications (called a session) across a network.
Manages the transmission of data across a network.
Handles addressing messages for delivery, as well as translating logical network addresses and names into their physical counterparts.
Handles special data frames (packets) between the Network layer and the Physical layer.
An adapter card that plugs into the system bus of a computer and allows the computer to send and receive signals on a network.

It is known for their ability to carry high-frequency signals over long distances with minimal interference. They are widely used for connecting cable television, satellite dishes, and in some cases, broadband modems to homes and businesses.

They are known for their high-speed data transmission capabilities and are commonly used in long-distance and high-bandwidth applications, such as telecommunications networks, data centers, and internet backbones.
These are prevalent in Ethernet networking, connecting devices like computers, switches, and routers. They are cost-effective and suitable for short to medium-distance network connections.
These cables are often used in industrial and commercial settings where there may be higher levels of electromagnetic interference.

Real World Networks.question: The arrangement of computers, cables, and other components on a network.
Consists of numbers of computers in a row connected by a single cable segment called trunk, also known as backbone or segment.
This topology provides a reliable signal that can travel large network because the signal is regenerated by each workstation when passed on to its neighbor.

This topology is used to connect computers in a workgroup or departmental local area network (LAN) using a hub. It can also be used to connect workgroup or departmental hubs using a master hub or switch.
A network topology in which additional networking components are used to provide redundant data paths.
It provides a direct link between each pair of nodes on the backbone network.
This only includes some redundant data paths to provide some level of fault tolerance.
Which of the following is the disadvantage of Bus topology?
Real World Networks.answer: A segment cable fault affects all workstations
incorrect: Bus Topology is easy to implement.

Real World Networks.question: Which of the following is an advantage of Ring topology?
incorrect: Malfunctioning workstations and cables create problems for the entire network

Real World Networks.question: All of these are disadvantages of Star topology except?
incorrect: Hub can be a single point of failure
Hubs are slightly more expensive than thin-Ethernet
Requires more cable than most other topologies

IP Addressing.question: In which IP address class does the range from 1.0.0.1 to 126.255.255.254 fall?
In which IP address class does the range from 128.1.0.1 to 191.255.255.254 fall?
In which IP address class does the range from 192.0.1.1 to 223.255.254.254 fall?
In which IP address class does the range from 224.0.0.0 to 239.255.255.255 fall?
In which IP address class does the range from 240.0.0.0 to 254.255.255.254 fall?
It tells us which network the device is part of
It identifies that unique device within the network
What is the default subnet mask for Class A IP address?
What is the default subnet mask for Class B IP address?
What is the default subnet mask for Class C IP address?
In which IP address class does the address 192.168.10.1 belong?
In which IP address class does the address 172.0.1.2 belong?
In which IP address class does the address 200.10.18.15 belong?
In which IP address class does the address 10.11.23.14 belong?
In which IP address class does the address 185.24.12.23 belong?
Which of the following is the dotted-decimal notation for the binary IP address: 11000000 10101000 00000010 00000101 ?
What is the dotted-decimal notation for the binary IP address: 10000001 00001011 00001011 11101111 ?
What is the dotted-decimal notation for the binary IP address: 11111001 10011011 11111011 00001111 ?
What is the binary representation of the IP address: 192.168.10.5 ?
Determine the binary representation of the IP address: 10.20.30.40 ?

The Router.question: The physical or virtual internetworking device that is designed to receive, analyze, and forward data packets between computer networks.
A router works on the what layer of the OSI model
Which of the following is not true about routers?
The Router.answer: A router analyzes a destination IP address of a given packet header and compares it with the routing table to decide the packet's next path, but routers do not use routing tables for this purpose.
incorrect: Routers are network devices that operate at the Network Layer (Layer 3) of the OSI model.
Routers are used to connect different network segments and route data packets between them.
Routers can perform Network Address Translation (NAT) to allow multiple devices on a local network to share a single public IP address for internet access.

The Router.question: These routers are used to offer Wi-Fi connectivity to laptops, smartphones, and other devices with Wi-Fi network capabilities, and it can also provide standard ethernet routing for a small number of wired network systems.
A combination of the bridge and a router. It allows transferring the data between networks like a bridge.
A type of router that can route the data within a network, but it is not able to route the data between the networks.
This router is a lower-capacity device that is placed at the boundary of a network.
This belongs to an end-user organization, and it works in a situation where it acts on a border device.
This is used in the boundary of Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) networks. It acts as a gateway between the LAN, WAN, or the internet.
A routing protocol which is used to calculate the best route for the given packets to reach the destination, as they move via a set of connected networks.
It helps manage how packets are routed on the internet via exchange of information between edge routers.
It specifies how routing information will be exchanged between gateways within an independent network.
It determines how routers can share information while transferring traffic among connected group of local area networks.
In this protocol, if a router is unable to find a path to a destination from the tables, it asks route to its neighbors, and they pass the query to their neighbors until a router has found the path.
It decides how routing information can be exchanged between two neighbor gateway hosts, each of which has its own router.
